description:
The investment seeks to track the investment results (before fees and expenses) of the Zacks International Multi-Asset Income Index.
 The fund generally will invest at least 90% of its total assets in the securities that comprise the index, as well as American depositary receipts ("ADRs") and global depositary receipts ("GDRs") that represent securities in the index. The index is comprised of securities that the index provider has identified as having potentially high income and superior risk-return profiles by using a proprietary strategy that evaluates stocks on multiple factors, including dividend yield and market capitalization. The fund is non-diversified.
